issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:

comments.body: I have attached patch to address this issue.

-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12525587/MAPREDUCE-4224.patch
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    +1 tests included.  The patch appears to include 1 new or modified test files.

    -1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool appears to have generated 2 warning messages.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    +1 eclipse:eclipse.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    +1 findbugs.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    +1 core tests.  The patch passed unit tests in hadoop-mapreduce-project/hadoop-yarn/hadoop-yarn-server/hadoop-yarn-server-resourcemanager.

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/2356//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/2356//console

This message is automatically generated.
Changes look good. TestCapacityScheduler has this same issue, would you mind updated it also?
Thanks a lot Thomas for looking into the patch. I have updated the patch with the change.

+1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12528844/MAPREDUCE-4224-1.patch
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    +1 tests included.  The patch appears to include 2 new or modified test files.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    +1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    +1 eclipse:eclipse.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    +1 findbugs.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    +1 core tests.  The patch passed unit tests in hadoop-mapreduce-project/hadoop-yarn/hadoop-yarn-server/hadoop-yarn-server-resourcemanager.

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.
